intro: Circaea pricei var. mairei, commonly known as the Maire's whitebeard, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The leaves are typically oval-shaped with a rough texture and are arranged alternately along the stem. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
